info.name: Firefox ZDark Theme 0.97v ─ Vertical Tabs
info.description:
Release Beta 0.97v
Requirements:Vertical Tabs Reloaded install [http://userstyles.org/styles/140828]
and [http://addons.mozilla.org/nn-NO/firefox/addon/vertical-tabs-reloaded]

Titlebarinstall [http://userstyles.org/styles/141500/firefox-zdark-titlebar]
The context menu style can be downloaded separately from here, but it's not required to install because it's already included with the theme. The style for them is downloadable from here: [http://userstyles.org/styles/140996/firefox-zdark-context-menus]
info.additionalInfo:
Dark Firefox theme. If you don't have VerticalTabs Reloaded installed, install it otherwise the theme won't work correctly. This theme is optimized for use with Firefox 52.0b9, after that, Mozilla did the WebExtensions update which breaks just about every add-on available, including Stylish. A WebExtensions version is available, continue reading for information regarding that. Additional Options:
 Click here to show the memory usage of each tab inside the tab. ─Note that you'll need to adjust the Add-On options. Tools -> Addons -> Tab Memory Usage -> Options ─ Memory Report Mode=inside Changelog: 4/19/2017, URL and Searchbar given a box-shadow and now look better. 8/19/2017, When Pop-Ups are blocked, the notification area will appear like this. (http://i.imgur.com/Wj55KW9.png) 8/23/2017, About Page designed, Changes to Main Menu Bar, Address Bar, and Search Box, Back and Forward buttons reverted to original Firefox Style, but previous version buttons left in place, but commented out. A WebExtensions version is in development, for more information follow me and message me on Facebook. ─ www.facebook.com/ZmVyc3SoF Starting from Firefox 53, no new legacy add-ons will be accepted on addons.mozilla.org (AMO) for desktop Firefox and Firefox for Android, this is a problem for zDark because it breaks Stylish and other extensions. I suggest you use Firefox 52.0b9. Starting from Firefox 57, only extensions developed using WebExtensions APIs will be supported on Desktop Firefox and Firefox for Android. (https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/the-addon-bar/)
